body_html:
@jgong5 No. These were last updated 3 months ago.

If you want to build a docker image yourself, then

# from your pytorch root
cd docker/caffe2/jenkins
./build.sh py2-cuda9.0-cudnn7-ubuntu16.04 -t py2-cuda-cudnn7-ubuntu16.04
# Or use another name, like py2-ubuntu16.04 or py3-mkl-ubuntu16.04
# in general should match (conda|py)(2|3)-[mkl-][cuda(8.0|9.0)-cudnn7-][gcc4.8-](ubuntu(14.04|16.04)|centos7)

docker run py2-cuda9.0-cudnn7-ubuntu16.04 # or what your image was
# <inside of docker run>
cd && git clone https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch.git --recursive && cd pytorch
./jenkins/caffe2/build.sh   # or .jenkins/pytorch/build.sh

body:
@jgong5 No. These were last updated 3 months ago. 

If you want to build a docker image yourself, then
```
# from your pytorch root
cd docker/caffe2/jenkins
./build.sh py2-cuda9.0-cudnn7-ubuntu16.04 -t py2-cuda-cudnn7-ubuntu16.04
# Or use another name, like py2-ubuntu16.04 or py3-mkl-ubuntu16.04
# in general should match (conda|py)(2|3)-[mkl-][cuda(8.0|9.0)-cudnn7-][gcc4.8-](ubuntu(14.04|16.04)|centos7)

docker run py2-cuda9.0-cudnn7-ubuntu16.04 # or what your image was
# <inside of docker run>
cd && git clone https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch.git --recursive && cd pytorch
./jenkins/caffe2/build.sh   # or .jenkins/pytorch/build.sh
